results.title: The Energy audit
results.creator_credit: Mark Poole, John Hipwell, Gas and Fuel Corporation of Victoria and Commonwealth Department of Primary Industries and Energy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Energy management in commercial buildings”.
Designed as part of a series of videos outlining practical ways to measure energy use in commercial buildings, this video concentrates on conducting an energy audit. In turn, this will help the building manager in completing an energy management program with the aim of identifying opportunities for energy cost saving.

results.title: The Broken covenant (A)
results.creator_credit: David M. Thompson, ABC-TV (Australia) and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Encounters”.
Many of Australia’s urban Aborigines live in appalling physical conditions and are seen by some Australians as derelicts. But to Father Ted Kennedy, a Catholic priest who works in the inner-city suburb of Redfern, they still retain an essential quality of life missing in white society.

results.title: A Plain and sacred right (A)
results.creator_credit: David M. Thompson, ABC-TV (Australia) and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Encounters”.
Looks at why Aboriginal people feel so strongly about their struggle for land rights. Filmed mainly at Noonkanbah, the scene of bitter Aboriginal demonstrations of 1980, the program looks at what Aboriginal people are now doing to preserve their traditional way of life. Tribal Aboriginals explain their bond with the land and put their views on white society.

results.title: The Adventures of the wishing chair
results.creator_credit: Jean Flynn, Abbey Home Entertainment and Cosgrove Hall Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Enchanted lands”.
A compilation of seven short animated stories from Enid Blyton’s Enchanted Lands series, “The Adventures of the wishing chair”. Let yourself be whisked away with Mollie, Peter and Jigs the Pixie on their amazing Wishing Chair to visit distant lands of magic, dreams and fantastical adventures. Meet some of the delightful, and not so delightful, characters along the way like Magician Greatheart, the Grabbit Gnomes and the playful Clown Gnomes. Beautifully animated with lots of colour, magic and movement. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: The Magic of the faraway tree. [Vol. 2] = More adventures at the faraway tree
results.creator_credit: Ben Turner, Abbey Home Entertainment and Cosgrove Hall Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Enchanted lands”.
A compilation of six short animated stories from Enid Blyton’s Enchanted Lands series, “The Magic of the faraway tree” featuring more fantastic adventures with Joe, Fran and Beth and their Faraway Tree friends. Be amazed in the land of Giants, careful in the land of Topsy Turvy where you might end upside down, and watch those magic spells in the land of Wizards. Excellent animation with lots of colour and movement. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Peter & Paul and the Christian revolution
results.creator_credit: Margaret Koval, Patricia Aste and Koval Films LLC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Empires”.
Traces the life of early Christians Peter and Paul, who faced powerful obstacles - including the mighty Roman Empire, political persecution and crippling personal disagreements - in their attempts to spread the word of Jesus. Episode 1. “The Rock and the river” - With the Messiah dead and their cause deemed subversive, the followers of Jesus face a bleak future, until their hope is re-invigorated by a vision of the risen Jesus. A former persecutor of Christians, Peter soon becomes an indomitable figure, uniting the group into a tight community of ardent believers. Paul, educated, passionate, determined and dogmatic, uses his formidable talents to spread his new beliefs around the Roman Empire. Episode 2. “The Empire and the Kingdom” - Led by missionaries, Christian ideas continue to spread among Jews and non-Jews throughout the Empire; hostile locals, imperial forces and conflicting ideas threaten the future of the movement. Paul splits with his former allies, establishing churches in his image; in 70 AD, after decades of tensions, a four-year war erupts that destroys much of Jerusalem, but the communities established by Paul survive and grow. Fascinating work features the words of Paul and other ancient writers, historical re-enactments and interviews with contemporary scholars.

results.title: Islam: empire of faith
results.creator_credit: Robert H Gardner, Public Broadcasting Service (U.S.), Devillier Donegan Enterprises and Gardner Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Empires”.
This three part history of Islam is narrated by Ben Kingsley. In episode 1, “The Messenger”, we are introduced to pre-monotheistic Arab society. In a desert world consisting of warring nomadic tribes, differences were only put aside when the tribes congregated in the holy city of Mecca to worship their individual gods and totems. From this centre of trade and religion, the Prophet Muhammad first began to receive visions from the one God. Though initially exiled by his opponents, Muhammad finds refuge in the oasis of Medina, and there he builds up a strong and loyal following united, for the first time, not by blood but by faith. Having conquered the Meccan forces sent to vanquish him and his followers, Muhammad triumphantly returned to Mecca, smashed the idols and proclaimed his divine message. In episode 2, “The Awakening”, the recording of the Prophet’s vision in the Koran sees the spread of Islam throughout the Arabian peninsula, and then to Persia, India, North African and Southern Europe and the Balkans. The religion leads to a democratisation of society and a flourishing of art, architecture, philosophy and science as the Muslim scholars integrate the thoughts of the ancient Greeks with the philosophy arising from Islam. The Islamic Empire is, however, threatened by the Crusades initiated by the fundamentalist European Christians, and then further dispersed by the massacres and invasions of the Mongol Empire. In episode 3, “The Ottomans”, we see how the Islamic world has been transformed by the Mongol invasion and the Mongols in turn have been transformed by their conversion to Islam. Nomadic tribes from Anatolia, enlisted to combat the Mongols, unite and form the beginning of the Ottoman Empire. One of the world’s largest empires, the Ottomans move into Christian Europe and take as their seat the Byzantine city of Constantinople. From the renamed city, Istanbul, the Ottomans create a flourishing art and culture. The episode concentrates on the career of Suleyman the Magnificent, the most talented, important and fierce of the Ottoman Sultans.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert H Gardner, Public Broadcasting Service (U.S.), Devillier Donegan Enterprises and Gardner Films
